verbose_text: XREF_BIBR XREF_BIBR Of particular importance to the work presented in this paper is Y346, which, when phosphorylated with Y342, acts to prevent Syk folding into an autoinhibited conformation, and Y519/520, which is located in the activation loop of Syk and is used as a marker for Syk activity.
evidence: prevent Syk folding into an autoinhibited conformation, and Y519/520
